result.execSummary:
The defendant Mary F. Schimming was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Submit to DNA sample, unless already provided.  Undergo any treatment per agent.  Absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances unless valid Rx.  Report Rx to agent within 2 working days.  No bars, taverns or liquor stores or any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  Submit to random urinalysis.    If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mary F. Schimming in court with attorney Blake J. Duren.  Defendant Mary F. Schimming in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State recommends 10 years probation, concurrent.  Attorney Duren makes final statement to the court.  Defendant makes final statement.  Court withholds sentence.
Count 1:
10 years Probation, concurrent.
DNA sample, unless already provided.
Undergo any counseling per agent.
AODA & treatment
Absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances unless valid Rx. Report Rx to agent within 2 working days.  
No bars, taverns or liquor stores.
Maintain full time employment
Submit to random urinalysis
$268.00 costs & $250.00 surcharge & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)
Paperwork handed in court.
Sentencing hearing at 08-03-2015 10:30 am

Defendant Mary F. Schimming in court with attorney Blake J. Duren.  Defendant Mary F. Schimming in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and parties state appearances.  State state recommendations and PSI request to be done w/argued sentencing date.  Atty Duren agrees w/statement by State and enters guilty pleas.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds guilty.  DE advised of rights re: felony firearms possession and voting rights.  Court orders PSI and that is to be completed no later than 7/24/2015.  Sentencing to be set after that date.  Bonds continued pending sentencing excluding in 14CF77 where bond is revoked.  State states prior OWI convictions on the record.  All outstanding warrants would be quashed.

State appears by ADA Michael Albrecht.  DE does not appear but Atty Blake Duren appears on her behalf.  Court states cases and appearances.  State requests warrants be issued for DE as she has failed to appear after many resets.  Requests plea/sent be set for Thursday as it's likely DE will be in custody and it can be completed.  Atty Duren responds.  Court authorizes warrants in each file and orders cash bond forfeiture begin in those files where cash was posted.  Court advises parties to get a plea date from his assistant.

Defendant Mary F. Schimming in court with attorney Blake J. Duren.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Frank was substituted for Attorney Duren.  Attorney Duren was retained.  Matters should not be delayed by late entry per Attorney Duren.  Attorney Frank agrees with substitution.  Attorney Duren agrees.  Defendant agrees.  Matters likely to resolve.  State request matter be set off the 1 p.m. calendar.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Mary F. Schimming by video from LEC with attorney Catherine Ankenbrandt Louise Ankenbrandt.  Defendant Mary F. Schimming in custody.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  State requests cash bond of $1,000.00.  Atty Ankenbrandt responds.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $1,000.00 cash bond set.  Atty Ankenbrandt believes Atty Ryan Frank will be representing the DE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 21, 2014 at 11:00 am.
